item.title: Rayman 30th Anniversary Edition Drops Digitally Tomorrow
item.content:encoded:
Rayman 30th Anniversary Edition drops digitally tomorrow on PlayStation 5.

In 1995, Rayman launched on the original Sony PlayStation, and more than three decades later, the original game is returning to PlayStation. During the Sony PlayStation State of Play presentation, it was announced that a special 30th Anniversary Edition of Rayman will launch digitally on February 13, just one day away from this writing. Physical editions will be available later in the year.

This will be a five-game collection, featuring five versions of the original game. The Nintendo Game Boy version was shown. The game was also originally released on PC, Sega Saturn, and the Atari Jaguar. There will also be a long-lost playable prototype and an interactive documentary featuring interviews and more.

More on Rayman’s 30th Anniversary Edition

Tom Henderson of Insider Gaming recently reported that Ubisoft is developing two new Rayman projects.

One of these projects, codenamed “Steamboat,” is thought to be a remake of Rayman Legends. This project was believed to be the one under the codename “Iceman.”

The game was previously rated in Australia as well. Learn more about that here.

How excited are you to play the original Rayman again and re-familiarize yourself with the original Ubisoft mascot? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Beast of Reincarnation Gets Release Date at State of Play
item.content:encoded:
Beast of Reincarnation, the highly anticipated post-apocalyptic Soulslike coming from Game Freak, has received a release date during the State of Play showcase. The game, which is a far cry from Game Freak’s Pokémon days, takes players and plunges them into a ruined Japan thousands of years in the future.

It has already been compared to games like Sekiro, Stellar Blade, and Elden Ring, but it has a focus on nature, mythical creatures, and an ever-changing, evolving world.

When is Beast of Reincarnation Coming Out?

Thanks to the new State of Play showcase broadcast on February 12, we know that Beast of Reincarnation is coming on August 4, 2026. The game had carried a 2026 release window since being revealed in 2025, but now we’ve got a much firmer date locked in.

While it was PlayStation that uncovered the release date, it was confirmed a short while ago that Beast of Reincarnation will be playable on Xbox Game Pass on day one.

Here’s the new trailer that was shared during State of Play to announce the game’s release date:

In Beast of Reincarnation, you assume control of Emma, a warrior infected with the same blight that has brought down the planet, but she alone can change the course of what’s unravelling to save humanity and its fragments. She’s joined by Koo, a powerful canine companion with his own affliction.

As you explore Beast of Reincarnation, you’ll uncover a sprawling world fraught with dangers, but you’ll have the ability to shape
Emma and Koo through RPG mechanics and varied approaches.

Are you looking forward to Beast of Reincarnation? Let us know if you’re planning to invest in the game on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Kena: Scars of Kosmora Announced at State of Play
item.content:encoded:
Kena: Bridge of Spirits is getting a sequel released on PlayStation 5 and PC in 2026.

This game, called Kena: Scars of Kosmora, was the first game announced during the February 2026 Sony PlayStation State of Play presentation. The game showed off new companions, new enemies, and more.

The developers briefly spoke after the trailer reveal, noting that their partnership with PlayStation has enabled them to expand the Kena world while staying true to the spirit of their 2021 game.

The Legacy of Kena: Bridge of Spirits

The developer stated that this game will follow an older Kena. It is also promised that there will be deeper, more dynamic combat, epic boss battles, more charming spirit companions, and a journey of following her as she learns how she helps the living as a Spirit Guide.

Ember Lab released the game in September 2021, and it is currently available on PlayStation, Xbox, and PC. It also won awards for the strength of its value as an independent game.

This game will be available on PlayStation and PC via Steam and the Epic Games Store. Check out the full lineup of games announced during this Sony State of Play at this link.

item.title: Death Stranding 2 PC Release Date Revealed at State of Play
item.content:encoded:
Hideo Kojima’s Death Stranding 2: On the Beach is finally receiving a PC port, and it will release on March 19th.

Players have been expecting the PC version of the sequel since its release, especially since the first title’s port arrived within a year. Moreover, an ESRB rating for the PC port of DS2 was leaked late in the year, further fueling anticipation. Finally, the release date has been revealed, along with a brand-new trailer.

Death Stranding 2 PC Features Revealed at State of Play

Death Stranding 2 PC’s March 19th release date was revealed during the latest PlayStation State of Play event. It arrived with a brand-new trailer outlining the PC features for the title, including higher framerate caps, support for ultrawide monitors, and DualSense controllers, of course.

Interested readers can check out the new trailer that Hideo Kojima has seemingly been editing below:

About Death Stranding 2

Kojima Productions’ Death Stranding 2 is a sequel, as the name suggests. In this installment, players follow Sam on a quest to save humanity from extinction in a new region: Australia. The terrain is vastly different, featuring dynamic weather and time cycles, as well as various natural disasters, including earthquakes, sandstorms, forest fires, and Timefall.

The combat gameplay has been enhanced with new weapons and other equipment. Players now have the option to use stealth and long-range attacks or engage directly in close combat with mech soldiers, unseen BTs, and new bosses. Additionally, the social aspect from the previous title has been improved, making players feel deeply connected to the world of Death Stranding 2. Every action taken in-game influences how players interact with their environments and vice versa.

In other news, the January 2026 Wave 2 for Xbox Game Pass added Death Stranding: Director’s Cut. Additionally, there’s a Death Stranding 2D hand-drawn anime from E&H Productions, expected to release on Disney+ in 2027. Will you be purchasing Death Stranding 2 once it releases for PC on March 19th? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Mewgenics Creator Defends Casting Choices Amid Criticism
item.content:encoded:
Edmund McMillen is one of the creators behind the new cat-breeding roguelike game, Mewgenics. The game has been a tremendous success in its first few days. Now, McMillen is addressing an issue affecting some players, some problematic personalities that have voiced some of the in-game cats.

McMillen, in a statement to Rock Paper Shotgun, explained that in some cases, the names included were listed years ago, such as Ethan and Hila Klein from h3h3, who have recently received criticism for their views on the conflict between Israel and Palestine.

McMillen noted that he wanted the game to feature iconic voices from most of his time online. He also argued that “The inclusion of Ethan and Hila was counterbalanced by iDubbbz and Anisa.” iDubbbz is another long-time internet personality who was once friendly with h3h3 but has since called them out for their views.

McMillen Says Inclusion of Those With Differing Ideologies Felt Appropriate for Mewgenics

Edmund McMillen told Rock Paper Shotgun that he contacted both parties to let them know about the other’s inclusion and said everyone was “very adult about it.”

Furthermore, he believes it was appropriate to have people with clashing ideologies in the game, saying that if the game simply included people with whom he shared the same opinions, he’d probably be the only one meowing in the game.

“I understand we live in a time where a meow from someone who has different beliefs as you is scary and frustrating, confusing and controversial…” McMillen continued, “But it felt interesting, so I decided to explore it.”

Still, the game has received tremendous critical acclaim, and it’s currently sitting at 89 on Metacritic with an overall user score of 8.1

item.title: Laid Off Highguard Tech Artist Reflects on Game’s Launch
item.content:encoded:
Josh Sobel, a tech artist who worked on Highguard, is reflecting on the highs and lows of the game’s development and launch in the wake of mass layoffs at Wildlight Entertainment.

Josh Sobel was one of the individuals laid off by Wildlight on February 11. After the announcement, he shared a lengthy post on Twitter reflecting on his experience working on the game. He mentioned that he had personally worked on the project for two and a half years.

His Twitter statement says that before the game’s reveal at the Game Awards in 2025, the team was receiving positive feedback. In cases of negative feedback, it was always constructive criticism. After the trailer dropped, Sobel says it was “downhill from there.”

“Even if Highguard had a rocky launch, our independent, self-published, dev-led studio full of passionate people just trying to make a fun game, with zero AI, and zero corporate oversight…deserved better than this.”

He then wished the remaining staff members luck and said he hopes the game can continue because he still believes in the project.

Wildlight Previously Stated A Core Team Will Continue to Work on Highguard

Confirming the news of layoffs in a social media post on February 11, Wildlight stated that a core group of developers would remain on staff to continue “innovating and supporting the game.” This came after a senior designer revealed on LinkedIn that he had been let go, along with most of the team.

Unfortunately, Layoffs continue to be a trend in the gaming space. Riot Games recently issued a statement very similar to theirs about their decision to downsize the team working on 2XKO. Read that full statement here.
